# Daily Assistant Resources

## Productivity Methods & Resources

### Time Management Techniques
| Method | How It Works | Best For |
|---|---|---|
| **Pomodoro** | 25 min focus + 5 min break, 4 cycles then 15 min break | Sustained focus on single tasks |
| **Time Blocking** | Assign specific hours to specific tasks in calendar | Structured days, preventing overcommitment |
| **Eisenhower Matrix** | Categorize by urgent/important → Do, Schedule, Delegate, Delete | Prioritizing a backlog of tasks |
| **Eat the Frog** | Do the hardest/most important task first each day | Overcoming procrastination |
| **2-Minute Rule** | If it takes < 2 min, do it now | Clearing small tasks |
| **Deep Work** | 1-4 hour blocks of zero-distraction focused work | Complex creative/intellectual tasks |
| **Batching** | Group similar tasks together | Reducing context-switching |

### Goal Setting Frameworks
| Framework | Structure | Use Case |
|---|---|---|
| **SMART Goals** | Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound | Individual goals |
| **OKRs** | Objectives + 3-5 Key Results per objective | Team/org alignment |
| **12 Week Year** | Treat 12 weeks as a "year" for urgency | Ambitious personal goals |
| **WOOP** | Wish, Outcome, Obstacle, Plan | Behavior change |

### Productivity Tools
| Tool | Purpose | Free Tier? |
|---|---|---|
| **Notion** | All-in-one workspace, docs, databases | Yes |
| **Todoist** | Task management, projects | Yes |
| **Google Calendar** | Time blocking, scheduling | Yes |
| **Obsidian** | Personal knowledge management (local) | Yes |
| **Habitica** | Gamified habit tracking | Yes |
| **Forest** | Focus timer (plant a tree) | Freemium |
| **Toggl** | Time tracking | Yes |

### Books on Productivity
| Book | Author | Key Idea |
|---|---|---|
| **Atomic Habits** | James Clear | Small habits compound; 1% better every day |
| **Deep Work** | Cal Newport | Focused work is the new superpower |
| **Getting Things Done** | David Allen | Capture everything, process systematically |
| **The 7 Habits** | Stephen Covey | Principles-based effectiveness |
| **Make Time** | Knapp & Zeratsky | Highlight + laser + energize + reflect |
| **Essentialism** | Greg McKeown | Less but better; disciplined pursuit of less |

## Finance Basics

### Key Formulas
```
Compound Interest:   A = P × (1 + r/n)^(n×t)
Simple Interest:     I = P × r × t
EMI:                 EMI = P × r × (1+r)^n / ((1+r)^n - 1)
CAGR:                ((End/Start)^(1/years) - 1) × 100
Rule of 72:          Years to double = 72 / interest rate
```

### Investment Concepts
| Concept | What It Means |
|---|---|
| **Stocks** | Ownership shares in a company |
| **Bonds** | Lending money to govt/company for fixed interest |
| **ETF** | Basket of stocks/bonds traded like a single stock |
| **Index Fund** | Passively tracks a market index (S&P 500, Nifty 50) |
| **SIP** | Systematic Investment Plan — fixed amount at regular intervals |
| **Mutual Fund** | Pooled money managed by a professional |
| **P/E Ratio** | Price-to-Earnings — how expensive a stock is vs its earnings |
| **CAGR** | Compound Annual Growth Rate — smoothed annual return |
| **Diversification** | Spread investments to reduce risk |

### Budgeting Frameworks
| Method | Split | How It Works |
|---|---|---|
| **50/30/20** | 50% needs, 30% wants, 20% savings | Simple, good starting point |
| **Zero-Based** | Every dollar assigned a job | Maximum control |
| **Pay Yourself First** | Save first, spend the rest | Savings-focused |
| **Envelope System** | Cash in category envelopes | Physical spending limits |

## How to Use This Skill

1. **Identify the domain** — finance, productivity, news, or research?
2. **Use the right framework** — apply the relevant method/formula from above
3. **For current information** — use `fetch` to scrape news sites and product pages
4. **Keep it actionable** — every response should end with a clear next step
5. **Never give financial advice** — always frame as educational/informational
